greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of endofunctions on [n] such that no element has a preimage of cardinality k; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..140, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, i, k) option remember; `if`(n=0 and i=0, 1,
mathematica: nn = n; f[m_]:=Flatten[Table[m[[j, i - j + 1]], {i, 1, Length[m]}, {j, 1, i}]]; f[Transpose[Table[Prepend[Table[n! Coefficient[Series[(Exp[x] -x^k/k!)^n, {x, 0, nn}],x^n], {n, 1, 10}], 1], {k, 0, 10}]]] (* _Geoffrey Critzer_, Jan 31 2015 *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jul 21 2014
